data.title: Extension installation dependencies
data.body:
We want to support extensions depending on other extensions and having that transitive closure installed when installing the first one. Eg. `vscode-go` could depend on `vscode-go-syntax`.

This requires `vsce` work:
- [x] Figure out a syntax for `package.json` to indicate extension dependencies: `extensionDependencies`
- [x] Map dependencies to version properties, _queriable_ from the Marketplace: Microsoft/vscode-vsce#124
  - Property: `Microsoft.VisualStudio.Code.ExtensionDependencies` 

For `vscode`:
- [x] Figure out extension transitive closure, from version properties.
- [ ] Render that in the extension editor. Tracked in #12756 
- [x] Figure out how to notify user that more extensions will be installed (`Install all`, `Install this extension only`, `Cancel`)

We're leaving _Uninstall_ out of the story for now.

data.title: Workspace extension recommendations
data.body:
We'd like to support workspace extension recommendations.
- [x] Figure out how a workspace can list extension names
  - [x] Create JSON schema for it
- [x] Implement an extension viewlet filter (eg `@recommended:workspace`)
- [x] Figure out how to notify a user that there are workspace extension recommendations

data.title: Question: Is it possible to "merge" completion provider results
data.body:
Hey guys

I was wondering if the following scenario is possible:
When I register my custom `CodeCompletionProvider` (which now works like a charm, thanks to Johannes Rieken), the default provider from VSCode is kinda deactivated.

When I explicitly call the suggestions, it more or less works, but not on all scenarios.

I'd like to merge the results of my provider with the original providers of vscode. Or at least extend the base result with my results.

The problem is, if I overwrite the default provider and deliver non imported symbols to complete, stuff like `[].some` or other array functions are not completable anymore. My completionprovider does not index those functions, so there are not visible anymore.

It would be cool if both information would be there.

Cheers
Chris


data.title: Possible to bring up multiple dialogs on same dirty file when closing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open a few files
2. Make a file dirty
3. Open a few more files
4. Hit Cmd+W multiple time very quickly 
5. When tabs close one by one and it reaches to the file that was dirty, it prompts you to save that file, choose the cancel option

VSCode will show you the save dialog again and again. Apparently it cached the close command to that file.

data.title: Function calls with function arguments tab-complete incorrectly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OS X (El Capitan) 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new file and save it as (anyname).ts
2. Enter the following code:

``` ts
var arr = [1, 2, 3];
arr.map
```
1. Press <TAB>
2. Result would be 

``` ts
var arr = [1, 2, 3];

arr.map(callbackfn, value, index, array, thisArg)
```

Which is incorrect, since Array.map accepts 2 arguments -- callbackfn and thisArg.

In fact, any funcall with functional argument tab-completes into a call with more arguments then it should be.

Expected behaviour would be completion to

``` ts
arr.map(callbackfn, thisArg)
```

data.title: Feature Request: File->Print

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Open the File Menu

Expected Result:
There is an option to print the currently open buffer.

Actual Result:
No option to print.

Why it's important:
Sometimes, you have a need to print some code out - either as a reference, or to aid in debugging, or for other reasons.

It's rather disappointing to not find a "print" option in the editor.

data.title: C++ Syntax Highlighting not handling multi-lines macros properly
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.2 - OS Version: 10.11.6, Linux ubuntu 16.04 Have some C++ with macros defined on multiple lines: like: ``` #define INIT_WATCHABLE(name, val) \ name(val, "MediaDecoderStateMachine::" #name) #define INIT_MIRROR(name, val) \ name(mTaskQueue, val, "MediaDecoderStateMachine::" #name " (Mirror)") #define INIT_CANONICAL(name, val) \ name(mTaskQueue, val, "MediaDecoderStateMachine::" #name " (Canonical)") class MediaDecoder; ``` Note that class MediaDecoder; is showed as entirely blue. The next line will be okay if you have another forward declaration. But with more complex code it will look like so: If you rewrite the macro to be on a single line, so that \ isn't needed, then syntax highlighting will appear okay.

data.title: Expose terminal process ID through API
data.body: Part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11422

data.title: Visual Studio code shouldn't attempt to update git until it has focus
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OS 10.11.6

This is something that has bugged me with XCode for years, and unfortunately, I'm experiencing the same issue with VS.

Typical use case:
- Have VS opened, could be on the git pane.
- In a terminal, performed git operations such as a rebase.

You can see that VS attempts to update the git view, even though it hasn't got the focus.

This leads to git operation in the terminal failing due to:
fatal: Unable to create '/Users/jyavenard/Work/Mozilla/mozilla-central/.git/index.lock': File exists. As you can only have one git operation going at a time.

While the likelihood of the failure to occur appears to be much lesser than with xcode, I still get it occasionally.

Solution: VS shouldn't attempt to perform a git operation, unless it has the focus.

data.title: September Iteration Plan
data.body:
## Endgame Schedule
- _September, 26th_ Code freeze for the endgame
- _September, 30th_ Endgame done
##### Verification
- [ ] Verification ([wiki](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification)): since there are quite some old bugs to verify we verify by age, youngest first. The queries are:
  - [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
  - [ ] [September Bugs](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?page=1&q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+closed%3A%3E%3D2016-09-01&utf8=%E2%9C%93)
##### Monday
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT
##### Tuesday
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET / 10pm PT on Monday
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET / 11pm PT on Monday
- [x] Testing
##### Wednesday
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the September milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] Verification (queries above)
##### Thursday
- [x] Fixing (scrutiny sets in - major bugs only - to be discussed in stand-up meeting, labeled as `candidate`)
- [x] Verification (queries above)
- [x] Add/update shrink-wrap files for built-in extensions if needed (see [instructions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8570#issuecomment-229669456)) (was done along the way)
- [x] Update `OSSREADME.json` for built-in extensions based on differences to generated `npm-shrinkwrap.json` files if needed **@alexandrudima**/**dbaeumer**
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **@alexandrudima**/**dbaeumer**
  - _The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore_
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **@alexandrudima**/**dbaeumer**
##### Friday
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@bpasero**
  - [x] yo generator **@bpasero**
  - [x] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node debug **@isidorn**
- [x] Translation input - **@dbaeumer**
- [x] Verification (queries above)
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)

  - [x] OS X - **@ramya-rao-a**
  - [x] Linux - **@mjbvz**
- [x] All release notes updated. Release notes are collected in a file named _`1_6.md`_ in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)

##### Friday/Monday

##### Wednesday

##### Thursday
- [x] Publish `Insider` with hand-picked and reviewed candidate fixes **@chrmarti**
##### Monday
- [x] Build stable for all platforms **@chrmarti**
- [x] Sanity check of installable bits
  - [x] Windows
    - [x] signed installer **@chrmarti**
    - [x] zip **@chrmarti**
  - [x] OS X **@chrmarti**
  - [x] Linux
    - [x] deb package 64-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] deb package 32-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] rpm package 64-bit **@chrmarti**
    - [x] rpm package 32-bit **@chrmarti**
    - [x] archives **@tyriar**
- [x] Publish website **@gregvanl**
- [x] Release [stable](https://vscode-builds.azurewebsites.net/stable) (commit: e52fb0bc) **@chrmarti**
- [x] Add a git tag to `HEAD` of `release/1.6` in format `1.6.z` **@chrmarti**
- [x] Twitter announcement **@chrisdias**
- [x] Enable scheduled `insider` builds **@chrmarti**
##### Thursday - Oct 13
- [x] Build stable for all platforms **@weinand**
- [x] Verify [fixed issues](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/milestone/31?closed=1)
- [x] Sanity check of installable bits
  - [x] Windows
    - [x] signed installer **@rebornix**
    - [x] zip **@rebornix**
  - [x] OS X **@ramya-rao-a**
  - [x] Linux
    - [x] deb package 64-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] deb package 32-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] rpm package 64-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] rpm package 32-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] archives **@tyriar**
- [ ] Publish website **@gregvanl**
- [x] Add a git tag `1.6.1` to HEAD of release/1.6 @tyriar
## General

This plan captures what we work on during September. We are back to our normal 4 week rhythm. We will ship **early October**.

Not unusual and still noteworthy: We will do several explorations that might or might not result in concrete deliverables in this or later releases.
## Dates
- _September, 26th_ Code freeze for the endgame
- _September, 30th_ Endgame done
## Plan Items

| Mark | Description |
| --- | --- |
| :runner: | work in progress |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |

data.title: VS Code locks after selecting a file in search in files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.1 (07d663dc1bd848161edf4cd4ce30cce410d3d877, 2016-09-08T21:33:49.307Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Bring up Search in files, search for specific text in file (inside git repository)
2. Click on a file or two, and it appears to freeze, and a short time later a window with "The window is no longer responding" appears.

data.title: Add root for intellisense to workspace settings
data.body:
It would be nice to be able to configure Intellisense to assume the workspace root is something other than the current directory, so that absolute (`/...`) or root-less (`...`) requires would load their Intellisense definitions:

Example:

**Require path**

```
var Modal = require('shared/elements/Modal');
```

**Actual path relative to project root**

```
app/assets/javascripts/shared/elements/Modal.js
```

data.title: Consider renaming "extension.update-all" to "workbench.extensions.action.updateAll"
data.body:
"extensions.update-all" doesn't conform to the current extension action naming convention. We currently use a "workbench.extensions.action." prefix and camelCase rather than hyphen.
This makes it harder to find in the DefaultKeyboardShortcuts non-bound list and keybindings.json IntelliSense.

data.title: Review handling of extraFiles with caches
data.body:
The fix for #11079 populates the cache with the 'extraFiles' when these might change between two invocations of quickOpen. Should investigate to instead include the extraFiles on top of the cache's results on each search.

The chance of this being a big problem is small because we spawn an update of the cache each time quickOpen opens.

Change (thanks @bpasero!): https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/83b97d009f5eb2493ca88983c9b5ed4742ba0dc1

data.title: Tab key indention not working properly on sections that contain "loop" tag
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586 Steps to Reproduce: 1.Enter the following code into VSCode editor window ``` <% for i = 1 to 20 This is just Some random info so that you can get an example of what I'm talking about loop %> ``` 1. Now highlight everything but the final line containing "loop" and hit TAB or SHIFT+TAB and the lines will indent correctly. 2. Now highlight everything including the "loop" and hit TAB or SHIFT+TAB and you will see it all get converted to a `

` tag. This just started today after the most recent update.

data.title: Icon overlay support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Give ability to assign multiple icons to some targets so that we can add overlay to existing icons.

Purposal:

``` js
"fileNames" : {
    ".editorconfig" : ["file", "overlay.config"], // Assign a multiple-layer icon
    ".test." : {"overlays" : "overlay.test"},     // Assign an overlay to existing icon
    ".tests." : {"overlays" : "overlay.test"},
}
```

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any project containing a config.json file
2. Click on config.json file to open it

Contents of config.json file is either empty, or VS Code displays the content of the previously viewed file

data.title: Auto-indent for Python spotty
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 and Ubuntu Linux 16.04

When writing certain Python code, auto-indent/de-indent fails to properly indent/de-indent lines as expected. For example, if I write:

```
if myVar == 1:
    print("This is equal to 1")
else:
    print ("This is not equal to 1")

```

The editor fails to automatically indent the "else" statement. it should be able to detect that I am entering an "else" statement and properly handle indentation and de-indentation. The same issue occurs on try/except blocks. 

```
try:
    subprocess.check_output("someprogram.exe")
except CalledProcessException:
    print("The process failed.")
```

The editor should be able to detect when it sees the except block starter and properly de--indent the code as expected.  As it stands, both the if/else and try/except blocks look like this when entered into the editor:

```
if myvar == 1:
    print("This is equal to 1")
    else:
        print("This is not equal to 1")

```

data.title: ALT + Arrows does not work in integrated terminal
data.body:
Alt and arrow keys insert characters into the terminal buffer instead of navigating to the begging and ends of words in the integrated terminal

Environment:
OS: OS X El Capitan 
Version: VSCode 1.5.2

Repro:
1. Open Integrated terminal 
2. Type 'cd ~/'
3. Press Alt + Left Arrow

Expected:
Cursor should jump to begin of ~/ so ~ is highlighted

Actual 
;5D is inserted into the buffer at cursors current location
